definition: to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle

sentences.english: Shut up or I'll crown you.
sentences.chinese: 住口，要不我就砸爛你的腦袋。

sentences.english: If I had caught that guy, I would have beaten his brains out.
sentences.chinese: 要是當時我逮住了那傢伙，準要砸爛他的狗頭。

sentences.english: He seemed to be claiming that the telephone system with several blows.
sentences.chinese: 他舉起粗笨的管子，連擊幾下就把電話設備砸爛了。

sentences.english: I want to crush men like Barras, " David said fiercely ."
sentences.chinese: “我要砸爛象巴勒斯那樣的人，”大衛氣憤地說。

sentences.english: First we crack the shell, and we then crack the nuts inside.
sentences.chinese: 我們首先砸爛果殼，然後砸爛裏面的果仁。

sentences.english: First we crack the shell, and we then crack the nuts inside.
sentences.chinese: 我們首先砸爛果殼，然後砸爛裏面的果仁。

definition: the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
